company.name: Apple Developer Academy at Universitas Ciputra

experience.description: The program supports a ten-month-long study at the Apple Developer Academy in Universitas Ciputra, Surabaya, Indonesia for the 2025 cohort.

projects.name: Soon
projects.description: 'Soon' is a narrative-driven 2D pixel game built using Unity, where you will guide the main character, Willow, through her emotional journey of aging. I wrote the kinematic character controller for this game from scratch.

projects.name: BookIt
projects.description: 'BookIt' is an app tailor made for the employees of Ciputra Hospital Surabaya to reserve meeting rooms and company drivers, which are highly limited in numbers. The app’s driver booking feature utilizes a carpool system, where a smart algorithm decides how an employee can be fit into an existing booking based on multiple metrics.

projects.name: TipsyBunny
projects.description: 'TipsyBunny' is a 3D multiplayer game built using Apple’s RealityKit and GameKit framework where you play as drunken bunnies and compete in throwing wine bottles at each other. I was the tech lead for this project.

projects.name: BirdBox
projects.description: 'BirdBox' is a 3D co-op augmented reality (AR) game built using Apple’s ARKit framework where each player attempts to best the other in a chicken fight.

projects.name: English Club
projects.description: Co-established a club to help other learners in the academy on their English speaking skills. This includes organizing public speaking/presentation workshops and an online collaborative session with learners in the Apple Developer Academy at POSTECH in Pohang, South Korea

responsibilities.name: Mail Server
responsibilities.description: Implementing and managing the software-side architecture and security of the company's mail server: troubleshooting security and network problems, responding to and mitigating network security breaches, active management of server.

experience.position: Teaching Assistant for INFO109: Non-Linear Data Structures

responsibilities.name: Teaching
responsibilities.description: Assisting in teaching the recitation sessions for the Fall 2024 class of INFO109: Non-Linear Data Structures.

responsibilities.name: Database Laboratory Maintainer
responsibilities.description: Maintaining the computing infrastructure of the university’s Database Laboratory.

projects.name: Thesis Document File Server
projects.description: Establishing and maintaining an in-house shared file pool server for the archival of the Informatics department thesis documents.

experience.location: Philadelphia, PA, United States of America

responsibilities.name: Leadership
responsibilities.description: Assisting the Student Representative in their duties in leading 20 national scholarship awardees at the University of Pennsylvania in fulfilling the IISMA program.

projects.name: BATIK Challenge
projects.description: Leading two groups in volunteering on two Bethesda Project homeless shelter sites.

relevant_courses: NETW108: Network Performance Measurement and Analysis
education.description: I graduated early—the total length of my studies was 3.5 years out of the normal 4 years.

education.location: Philadelphia, PA, United States of America
education.degree: International Guest Student Program (IGSP), School of Arts & Sciences
education.description: I studied as a foreign undergraduate exchange student at Penn's College of Arts & Sciences under the International Guest Student Program (IGSP) during the Fall 2023 semester. My studies during this time were fully funded under the Indonesian International Student Mobility Awards (IISMA) scholarship scheme. During the course of the semester, I took two graduate-level (master's/doctoral) computer science courses as an undergraduate student.

institution.name: Budi Mulia Dua International High School

education.description: I graduated from the Global Assessment Certificate Program (GAC), which was administered by American College Test, Inc. (ACT, Inc.). Its curriculum—an international, English-language one—was undertaken alongside the national Indonesian high school curriculum. During my time in high school, I also participated in a geological scientific research collaboration in Japan with students of Ritsumeikan Keisho Senior High School and Kaisei Senior High School.

skills.name: DevOps & Version Control
list: MATLAB Statistics and Machine Learning Toolbox

honors_and_awards.description: This is a fully-funded scholarship to study at the University of Pennsylvania for one semester from the Indonesian Government's Indonesian International Student Mobility Awards (IISMA) program.

volunteer_experience.description: I led two volunteering groups in two Bethesda Project–run homeless shelters in Philadelphia, PA, United States of America.

institution.name: The Australian Consortium for 'In-Country' Indonesian Studies

volunteer_experience.description: I volunteered as a student tutor for Monash University students in learning Bahasa Indonesia through Lembaga Bahasa Sanata Dharma University's ILCIC (Indonesian Language and Culture Intensive Course) in collaboration with Monash University's Global Immersion Guarantee (GIG) program and ACICIS (Australian Consortium for `In-Country' Indonesian Studies).

institution.name: Society for Informatics Students, Universitas Sanata Dharma

volunteer_experience.description: In the Universitas Sanata Dharma Informatics major's Informatika Belajar program, I tutored newly-admitted students in familiarizing themselves with the basics of programming.
I volunteered in a special school in Yogyakarta, where I helped with the day-to-day activities of blind students.
